results.title: Yahoo to Keep Alibaba Stake but Spin Off Core Businesses
results.abstract: Yahoo has decided to retain its Alibaba stake and will instead look at transferring its other assets, including Yahoo Japan, into a new company.

multimedia.caption: With Marissa Mayer as chief executive, Yahoo has made dozens of acquisitions and added original video and magazine-style content. But its core Internet operations are still struggling.
multimedia.copyright: Max Whittaker for The New York Times

results.title: Marissa Mayer Has a Year to Fulfill Yahoo’s Potential
results.abstract: With Yahoo’s one billion users and revenue of nearly $5 billion, investors would be salivating if Yahoo were a start-up, not a faded Internet company.

results.title: The Internet’s Loop of Action and Reaction Is Worsening
results.abstract: Wouldn’t it have been kind of a pleasant dream world, in these overheated last few weeks, to have lived free of social media?

results.title: How to Value Yahoo’s Core Business
results.abstract: The market may price it as less than zero, but a company with $4.5 billion revenue has real value.

results.title: Blendle, a Journalism Payments Start-Up, Targets a U.S. Start Date
results.abstract: The company allows small payments for articles and has half a million subscribers in Germany and the Netherlands.

results.title: Apple Names Periscope the Top iPhone App of 2015
results.abstract: Apple unveiled its best apps list for 2015, featuring what the company deems the most innovative and top software downloads of the year.

results.title: A Bad Review Is Forever: How to Counter Online Complaints
results.abstract: For small businesses that can live or die by word of mouth, an array of strategies helps track and respond to online ratings.

results.title: Yahoo Changes Its Mind About Alibaba Spinoff
results.abstract: Yahoo said it would retain its 15 percent stake in the Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba. Instead, the rest of what we know as Yahoo will be spun off.

results.title: Choosing an iPad Pro Keyboard
results.abstract: Apple’s Smart Keyboard was designed for its newer, larger iPad Pro tablet, but there are cheaper alternatives.

results.title: Australian Police Raid Home of Man Said to Be Likely Creator of Bitcoin
results.abstract: The police said the raid was for a tax investigation, and a spokesman denied any connection to the Bitcoin reports.
results.byline: By MICHELLE INNIS and AUSTIN RAMZY

results.title: Americans Attracted to ISIS Find an ‘Echo Chamber’ on Social Media
results.abstract: As the White House takes on the challenge of the Islamic State, it is focusing on the online community of sympathizers in the United States, who number in the hundreds and fit no single profile.
results.byline: By SCOTT SHANE, MATT APUZZO and ERIC SCHMITT
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

multimedia.caption: A collection of posts from Twitter accounts sympathetic to the Islamic State. Lions, a reference to warriors as “lions of Allah,” are a popular symbol. Some users praise the recent killings in San Bernardino, Calif., while others offer advice to prevent hacker groups like Anonymous from disabling pro-Islamic State accounts.

results.title: New York Looks Into ‘Speculative’ Ticket Resellers
results.abstract: The attorney general sent letters to StubHub and other resale sites regarding high-priced listings of concert tickets even before they go on sale.

results.abstract: The group’s $2.5 billion offer tops a deal with ON Semiconductor and may ignite a bidding war.
results.byline: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED
org_facet: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)

results.title: Bill Gates Takes On Climate Change With Nudges and a Powerful Rolodex
results.abstract: Mr. Gates, acting as an envoy between the worlds of business and policy, has pressed global leaders and tech billionaires to team up on clean technology.
results.byline: By CORAL DAVENPORT and NICK WINGFIELD
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

multimedia.caption: Bill Gates stood with world leaders in November at the climate change conference in France. From left, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada, Mr. Gates, President Obama, President François Hollande of France and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India.

results.title: Spotify Is Said to Have Reconsidered Its Free Access Policy for Big Acts’ New Albums
results.abstract: Lately the music streaming service has been under pressure to accommodate major acts that have shunned the freemium model that lets listeners hear songs free.

results.title: Yahoo Is Said to End Plan to Spin Off Alibaba Stake
results.abstract: The company will consider other options, including a possible sale of its core Internet operations, a person briefed on the matter said.
results.byline: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and VINDU GOEL

multimedia.caption: Marissa Mayer, Yahoo's chief, had planned to spin off Yahoo’s 15 percent stake in Alibaba and focus her attention on the company’s core business.

results.title: Europe Plans to Ease Copyright Rules on Using Digital Content
results.abstract: The proposals, part of a push toward a so-called digital single market, also include a review of online content aggregation by major sites like Google.

results.title: Qualcomm Is Accused of Violating Antitrust Rules in Europe
results.abstract: The authorities said the chip maker had abused its dominant market position in the region by offering financial incentives to smartphone and tablet manufacturers.

results.title: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing to Open Own Plant in China
results.abstract: The move is designed to protect its technology while playing to a China market brimming with makers of inexpensive smartphones.

results.title: Online Classes Appeal More to the Affluent
results.abstract: Residents of poor neighborhoods are less likely than those in wealthier ones to enroll in free online courses, a study finds.

results.title: Twitter’s Top Hashtags, Tweets and Users for 2015
results.abstract: Global unrest, terror attacks, same-sex marriage, a boy with a clock, Caitlyn Jenner and the drama of One Direction topped the list for 2015.

multimedia.caption: This year, One Direction ruled Twitter.

results.title: Video Feature: Apps, Like Elves, Help Make the Season Bright
results.abstract: Apps for creating animated video during the holidays, and for help thinking of gift ideas, organizing lists, tracking Santa and donating to charities.

results.title: Tech Toys to Inspire a Child’s Imagination
results.abstract: These interactive toys incorporate various technologies including virtual reality, animation and robotics.

results.title: How to Sell or Recycle Old Electronics
results.abstract: Reviewing the gadget trade-in and recycling programs offered by Amazon, Gazelle and Best Buy.

results.title: Black Friday Deal or Dud? How to Shop Smart This Holiday Season
results.abstract: Only a small fraction of Black Friday discounts are true bargains, according to the editor of The Wirecutter, a product recommendation site. But there’s a way to check which purchases are worthwhile.

results.title: Gear VR Offers a Preview of Virtual Reality in the Home
results.abstract: For an early stab at consumer virtual reality, the Gear VR is a work in progress that can cause eye strain and weigh heavily on the head.

multimedia.caption: An image from the game Jurassic World, available in virtual reality on the Gear VR.

results.title: Special Section: Wired Well
results.abstract: We explore the lives of newly wired consumers and the consequences, good and bad, that arise from our increasing reliance on trackers, monitors, guides and a vast array of other devices to better our health.

results.title: The High Price of Delivery App Convenience
results.abstract: With a tap on a smartphone, consumers in some areas can have almost anything delivered within hours. But the cost of that is significant, and not always obvious.

results.title: Updating Windows 10
results.abstract: As part of its switch to Windows 10 as a “service” that automatically updates itself, Microsoft has pushed out its Windows 10 November Update.
